translated: “The Fortunate One Koṇḍañña,🔽free from passion, the one with equanimity,
the one who meditates without elaboration.
The one who has gone beyond all delusion,

analyzed: sabbaloka hita īsinaḥ  abbhañjanam mayā dinna
translated: the one who is beneficial to all the world,🔽I gave a fan
to the one with equanimity, the lord of men.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the fan-giving.
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Abbhañjanadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā abbhañjanadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Abbhañjanadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai abbhañjanadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽abbhañjanadāyaka therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Elder Abbhañjanadāyaka’s Birth Story, the fourth.
